page.title: 02Holbeach Hurn
page.content: The village developed along the Sea Bank of Roman or Saxon times.It is an isolated village but is a very close knit community.Three large farms are based around the village as well as a few smallholdings and nurseries.In October 1983 the population of the village was approx. 166.There is a church,a village hall,(the old village school),a playing field and park, a tennis court,one public house,(The Rose and Crown) and a village shop and Post Office.There is a play group, youth club,and Friendship Club.The village has a bus stop and shelter but no public transport.Three school buses come through each morning and evening to take children to and from schools in Holbeach Bank, Holbeach and Spalding.
